name: Slickin.com
overview:
The Problem: Many businesses are facing the same problem whether itâ€™s a seller on eBay or Amazon Marketplace or a small business or a mid-size business or a large corporate, how to promote my product/service within a reasonable price range and within a short period of time.

There are a lot of solutions out there in the market Banner Ads, Text Ads, Pay-per-view, Pay-per-click, Affiliate programs, Advertising Agencies, Branding companies, Social media marketing etc. But of these solutions Advertiser is not sure whether he/she is getting a return on every dollar they spend or sometimes even not sure if their product/service will success or fail.

Letâ€™s take for example Banner Ads. The very well known advertising solution and out there in the market for a reasonably long time. The Advertiser who posts a banner ad is not sure how many viewers have really become customers, but the Advertiser keeps paying on and on and on. Itâ€™s the same situation with any other advertising solution out there, some or the other kind of problem with every solution.

Solution: The solution is just one word, Slickin. We will change the way businesses promote their products/services. The Advertiser will not pay anything for nothing, pay when you make something. The limit of your team size working to promote you is 1.73 billion people.

This will be the fastest way to promote your product. Think of 1000’s of people promoting you vigorously throughout the internet. Within no time you will be everywhere. We are not just getting you everywhere; your team will add their creative skills to convert the viewers to your customers.

The internet changed a lot and the same way customer has also changed: We need to have a dialogue not monologue. We need one-to-one marketing not one way marketing. We need real time promoterâ€™s not static advertisements. We need rich customer interaction, should not be in a position hard to identify customers.

In a normal scenario, brands would spend less than 4% on advertising and promotion through Slickin. Brands usually spend around 50% of their revenue on marketing and advertising.
